main event: Two round, glowing objects were spotted by military personnel at Peterson Air Field, Colorado on April 15, 1949.
interesting points: The objects followed a straight course, with one object overtaking the other in about 2 seconds.
The objects were estimated to be 6-8 inches in diameter at an altitude of around 30,000 feet.
The objects were the color of a frosted light bulb and were first observed at about 10 o'clock, passing out of sight in about 30 seconds.
The observers included a Major, a Technical Sergeant, and a Master Sergeant from the 15th Air Force at Peterson Air Field.
No photographs or sketches of the objects were available due to the height and short duration of the sighting.
witnesses: Major Joe R. Bullock, T/Sgt Leonard Pink, T/Sgt Walter J. Norbeck
